explanation: Manually crafts and transmits a WOL magic packet (6x 0xFF + 16x MAC) to the broadcast address, directly demonstrating Traffic Signaling mechanics without third-party binaries. Detection: inspect outbound UDP broadcasts to port 9, and consider NIDS signatures for the WOL byte pattern.
rationale_steps: Format the MAC address and construct the magic packet bytes per the WOL specification.
Use UdpClient with broadcast enabled to send on UDP/9.
No obfuscation: payload is clear and structurally identifiable.
Detect with NIDS pattern-matching on the WOL byte sequence and NetFlow for UDP/9 anomalies.
